page.title: 06Farming continued
page.content: Nearly all the farmers employ men. Seven farmers employ one or two full time men.Eight farmers use casual labour at busy times.The other farmers do not employ anybody at all. Eleven farmers rear sheep.Four farmers rear Suffolk and four Mashams.One rears Texal,one Scottish half breed and Jacob sheep.Thirteen farmers rear cattle.Eight rear Hereford,nine Friesian,five Charollais,two Simmental and one Limousin. We asked 15 farmers how old their farmhouse was.The youngest house is 12 years old and the oldest house,Youlton Hall is 645 years old. Seven houses are about 200 years old and three are about 300 years old. Some farmers say farming is much easier now than in the past.Farming has become
